item.title: My sister is buying our parents’ $3 million house, but wants to deduct $100K for renovations. Who’s right?
item.description: “If she didn’t want the home, it would have been sold at fair market value.”

item.title: ‘People are often unreasonable when money is involved’: My husband, 62, gave me a 5-year life estate. Would I have to pay for a new roof?
item.description: “He has included a provision stating that I would be responsible for ‘maintenance and expenses’ during my occupancy.”

item.title: I’m inheriting $250K. Will paying off my student loans and credit-card debt hurt my credit score?
item.description: “The money is coming from the proceeds of the sale of a family home.”

item.title: ‘It’s an expensive piece of equipment’: My neighbor asked to borrow my snowblower. Do I say yes?
item.description: “The projected snowfall this weekend doesn’t look to be changing too much.”

item.title: ‘I need protein shakes’: Couples disagree about panic-buying for this weekend’s snowstorm
item.description: There’s one thing worse than hunkering down during a snowstorm — and that’s doing so with someone who resents your spending.
